Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_nic_fwupdate_stress.openbmc_nic_fwupdate_stress

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase

import json
import re
"""
This function updates the OpenbMC NIC firmware of all machine types
"""



[docs]class OpenbmcNicFwupdateStress(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(OpenbmcNicFwupdateStress, self).__init__()
        self.nicupgrade_file = self.test_control['nicupgrade_file']



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the OpenBMC NIC FW update test")

        self.get_json_data(self.nicupgrade_file)
        cycle_count = self.cycle_count
        file_path = self.file_path
        golden_ver = self.golden_ver
        required_ver = self.required_ver
        required_string = self.required_string
        previous_ver = self.previous_ver
        previous_string = self.previous_string

        nic_type, version, device_id = self.get_nic_type_and_fw_version()
        self.log_info(
            "Detected %s Nic with FW version %s" % (nic_type, version)
        )
        if (nic_type == "Mellanox"):
            for n in range(0, cycle_count):
                self.log_info("Iteration %d started" % (n + 1))
                file_to_copy, dest_loc, match_string = self.copy_required_file_to_host(
                    version, required_ver, required_string, previous_ver,
                    previous_string, file_path
                )
                self.mellanox_update(file_to_copy, dest_loc, device_id)
                version = self.validate_nic_fw(match_string)
                self.log_info("Completed %d Iteration" % (n + 1))

            self.log_info("Checking for the recent version")
            if (golden_ver != version):
                file_to_copy, dest_loc, match_string = self.copy_required_file_to_host(
                    version, required_ver, required_string, previous_ver,
                    previous_string, file_path
                )
                self.mellanox_update(file_to_copy, dest_loc, device_id)
                version = self.validate_nic_fw(match_string)
            else:
                self.validate_condition(
                    True, "Host is running with version: %s" % (version)
                )


    # Gets the nic_type, FW_version and device_id

[docs]    def get_nic_type_and_fw_version(self):
        cmd = "lspci | grep -i ethernet"
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        match_nic = re.search("Mellanox", out)
        match_type = re.search("ConnectX-4 Lx", out)
        if match_nic and match_type:
            nic_type = "Mellanox"
            # Get the PCI device ID"
            cmd = "mst status"
            out = self.host.run(cmd)
            for line in out.splitlines():
                pci_device_id = line
            # Get the firmware version
            cmd = "mstflint -d %s -qq q" % (pci_device_id)
            out = self.host.run(cmd)
            for line in out.splitlines():
                ver = re.search("FW Version:", line)
                if ver:
                    fw_version = line.split(":")[1].lstrip()
                    break
        else:
            match = re.search("Broadcom", out)
            if match:
                nic_type = "Broadcom"
                self.validate_condition(
                    False, "Broadcom Nic detected...Skipping for now"
                )
            else:
                self.validate_condition(False, "Unknown NIC detected")
        return nic_type, fw_version, pci_device_id



[docs]    def copy_required_file_to_host(
        self, version, required_ver, required_string, previous_ver,
        previous_string, file_path
    ):
        if (version == required_string):
            file_to_copy = previous_ver
            match_string = previous_string
        else:
            file_to_copy = required_ver
            match_string = required_string
        dest_loc = "/root/" + file_to_copy
        file_to_copy = file_path + file_to_copy
        return file_to_copy, dest_loc, match_string



[docs]    def mellanox_update(self, file_to_copy, dest_loc, device_id):
        try:
            cmd = "ls %s" % (dest_loc)
            self.host.run(cmd)
        except Exception:
            self.log_info("Copying the file to the host")
            self.host.put_file(file_to_copy, dest_loc)
        self.log_info("Update in progress")
        cmd = "mlxfwmanager -u -d %s -i %s -f -y" % (device_id, dest_loc)
        self.host.run(cmd)  # noqa
        self.host.oob.power_reset()



[docs]    def validate_nic_fw(self, match_string):
        nic_type, new_version, device_id = self.get_nic_type_and_fw_version()
        self.validate_equal(
            new_version, match_string, "Validate for new version detected"
        )
        return new_version



[docs]    def get_json_data(self, json_file):
        try:
            with open(json_file) as data_file:
                datadict = json.load(data_file)
            self.log_info(datadict)
            self.file_path = datadict['file_path']
            self.required_ver = datadict['required_ver']
            self.previous_ver = datadict['previous_ver']
            self.required_string = datadict['required_string']
            self.previous_string = datadict['previous_string']
            self.cycle_count = datadict['cycle_count']
            self.golden_ver = datadict['golden_ver']
        except IOError as exc:
            raise IOError("%s: %s" % (json_file, exc.strerror))




[docs]def main():
    test = OpenbmcNicFwupdateStress()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
